quiz.title: Economics: Cost, Equilibrium, Elasticity, and Demand

questions.question: The cost of one thing in terms of the alternative given up is known as:
questions.explanation: Opportunity cost is the value of the next‑best alternative forgone when making a decision.

questions.question: When equilibrium price rises but equilibrium quantity remains unchanged, the cause is:
options: Supply and demand both increase equally
Supply and demand both decrease equally
questions.explanation: A decrease in supply (left shift) raises price, while an increase in demand (right shift) also raises price—if they shift so that quantity stays the same, price increases with unchanged quantity.

questions.question: If demand is unitary elastic, a 25% increase in price will result in:
questions.explanation: With unitary elasticity (Ed = −1), the percentage change in quantity demanded equals the percentage change in price in opposite direction, so a 25% price increase causes a 25% decrease in quantity demanded.

questions.question: Contraction of demand is the result of:
options: Decrease in the number of consumers
Increase in the price of the commodity concerned
Increase in the prices of other goods
Decrease in the income of purchasers
questions.explanation: Contraction of demand refers to a reduction in quantity demanded due to a rise in the good’s own price (movement along the demand curve).
